description.narrative: Matco Rice Processing (PVT) Ltd. (the Company) is a private-family owned limited company engaged in rice processing and export business. The Company has three rice processing plants, two in Karachi (Matco 1 & Matco 2) and one in Sadhoke. Rice is procured from Punjab and Sindh provinces and stored in warehouses in Karachi and Lahore. The production activity in Karachi comprises mainly of re-processing include polishing, length grading, color sorting, and packing lines of 5 and 25 tons per hour (tph) capacity respectively whereas Sadhoke has paddy drying, storage and milling processing line of 10 tph capacity. The project is to construct a modern rice paddy drying, husking and parboiling plant at Sadhoke, Punjab and storage capacity in Sadhoke (the Project).

The expected development impact includes the following: (i) Employment: The Project will generate 300 new rural jobs and about 200 seasonal employees in Punjab in 2 years; (ii) Farmers reach: The Project will create additional backward linkages which are expected to generate benefits to approximately 1,500 farmers in the region; (iii) Improved agri-infrastructure: The Project will increase automatic drying capacity by 45,000 MT and automated silo capacity by 30,000 MT thus improving food storage in the Punjab region and reducing losses and bottlenecks; and (iv) Better quality product: The company will expand the production of its high quality branded rice products in Pakistan.
